page.title: 07FORYD HARBOUR.
page.content: The{RIVER CLWYD}enters the{IRISH SEA} at the {FORYD ESTUARY.}The word "Foryd" is a compression of two Welsh words"for" (sea) and"rhyd"(ford).The main feature of the harbour is the {FORYD BRIDGE}which carries the A548. The bridge was built in 1932 at a cost of{Â£85,000}and is a double span steel arch. Only two{commercial fishing boats}are left from a once thriving industry,and these supplement their incomes through tourism. The dock owned by Charles Jones & Co. is no longer used for {TIMBER {IMPORTING}and the principal use of the harbour is now for{PLEASURE CRAFT}.
